intro: Sida lomana, commonly known as Hawaiian sida, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a hairy texture. Sida lomana is adapted to coastal and disturbed habitats, thriving in sandy soils and full sunlight.
